frameDefinitions: A Speaker uses a particular linguistic form, a Name to refer to an Entity.
A Speaker conventionally uses a particular Term to refer to an Entity.
A Defender responds to an Assailant's attack on a Victim by directly, and usually violently, countering it.
This frame concerns internally undifferentiated Substances.
A Figure is located in the interior (the Profiled_region--see Locative_relation frame) of the Ground.
A Speaker uses as a Label to refer to an Entity.
frameExamples: They corresponded frequently and at length, exchanging intimate letters in which he <t>addressed</t> her as Windflower.
The pattern of conservation is similar to that found in C1_1, therefore we have <t>termed</t> this domain DC1 for divergent C1 domain.
Samantha stalwartly <t>defended</t> the gateway from the wraiths, crouching low over Stephen's prone form.
As their gut bacteria ferment cellulose , they generate methane <t>gas</t> , which escapes from the rear ends of the insects.
The bookmark <t>inside</t> her book was torn and written on .
listRoleDefinitions: The person who uses the <fen>Name</fen>  to refer to the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The entity that is designated by the <fen>Speaker</fen> with the <fen>Name</fen> used.
The linguistic form used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to refer to the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The point of time or interval when the <fen>Speaker</fen> uses the <fen>Name</fen>.
The type of <fen>Entity</fen> that is conventionally referred to by a <fen>Term</fen>.
The linguistic sign that is used for referring to a type of <fen>Entity</fen>.
The speaker or speech community that uses a <fen>Term</fen> to refer to a particular <fen>Entity</fen>.
This role is the being or entity that responds forcefully to the <fen>Assailant</fen>'s attack.
The person (or other self-directed entity) that is attempting physical harm to the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The individual or entity that is under attack from the <fen>Assailant</fen> .
This role identifies the time when the Defender takes forceful action against the Assailant.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Defender</fen> defends the <fen>Victim</fen> from the <fen>Assailant</fen>.
The undifferentiated entity which is presented as having a permanent existence.
The <fen>Figure</fen> is the entity located with respect to the <fen>Ground</fen>.
The <fen>Ground</fen> is the area that the <fen>Figure</fen> is located in.
The area or zone interior to the <fen>Ground</fen>.  This role excludes <fen>Figure</fen> and is only used in particular constructions such as the following:
The time during which the <fen>Figure</fen> was located in the <fen>Ground</fen>.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person who conventionally uses a linguistic sign to refer to an <fen>Entity</fen>.
The concrete or abstract thing with which the <fen>Speaker</fen> has associated a particular linguistic sign.
The linguistic sign that the <fen>Speaker</fen> uses to designate the <fen>Entity</fen>.
A text whose author applies a particular <fen>Label</fen> to an <fen>Entity</fen>.
A time period in which a <fen>Speaker</fen> uses the <fen>Label</fen>.
A physical space whose occupants use the <fen>Label</fen> to refer to the <fen>Entity</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The Lord, who was charmed by her beauty,</fex> addressed her as 'than kaadhali!' (My darling) and hence the name.
And that's the reason why we called <fex>him</fex> 'Tom' when his real name was actually John.
A male voice answered the call, and Jones addressed the man as <fex>'Johnny.'</fex>
No one had <fex>ever</fex> called her 'my lady'.
Because of that shift, physicists call <fex>this effect</fex> the 'gravitational red shift.'
The French term this plant <fex>Petit Chêne</fex>, from the shape of the leaves.
<fex>Mathematicians</fex> call this subject 'arithmetic,' reserving the word 'algebra' for the more advanced aspects of the subject.
<fex><t>Liquid</t></fex> flowed over the rocks but it was not water.
Inside the cupboard was <fex>a good place to hide</fex> .

He termed <fex>it</fex> 'a pretty incredible discovery' on par with two other 10,000-
to 11,000-year-old specimens
<fex>Your article</fex> labels him 'Republican Senator Jim Exon'.
<fex>Back in the olden days</fex>, they called it 'Bohemian people.'
I really loved this movie. <fex>In France</fex>, they called it 'Turbo Interceptor'.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the House Ways and Means Committee
the Federal Estate and Gift Tax and Generation-Skipping Transfer Tax
the second year in a row
